item.title: Kademlia: Summary (Based on the 2002 Paper)
item.description:
Awkward sentences and improvements:

  1. Original: “A node that joins a Kademlia cluster runs the look-up to fill addresses in (k)-buckets.”
    Issue: Article misuse, “the look-up” unnatural, “fill addresses” unidiomatic.
    Fix: “A joining node performs a recursive lookup to populate its k-buckets.”

  2. Original: “A node to join the cluster should have at least one address of the cluster.”
    Issue: Infinitive construction awkward; “address of the cluster” vague.
    Fix: “To join, a node must know at least one existing contact.”
